About Me

Innovating Health Technology Through Research and Development

Hello! I'm Reza Darooei, currently an FCS Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Software Engineering at the University of Bern, supported by the Swiss Government Excellence Scholarship. I hold a Ph.D. in Biomedical Engineering from Isfahan University of Medical Sciences, where I specialized in OCT cyst segmentation using deep learning and sparse basis methods.

My research focuses on developing VR-based blended learning solutions to enhance physician-patient communication, particularly in managing distress among pediatric patients. By creating immersive training environments, I aim to bridge gaps in traditional medical education and improve clinical care outcomes.

Previously, I worked as a Regulatory Affairs Specialist at the Iran Food and Drug Administration, overseeing compliance for medical devices and AI systems. Alongside my academic career, I am passionate about startups and freelancing, providing early-stage ventures with technological and business development support, including prototype design, market analysis, and strategic planning.

My technical toolkit spans Python, MATLAB, C++, C#, JavaScript, Unreal Engine, Unity, and advanced game development tools like Daz3D, iClone, and Maya, enabling me to build interactive, research-driven experiences at the intersection of healthcare, AI, and immersive technology.

Curious about my publications? Visit my Google Scholar profile to explore my research, or browse the Work section to view selected projects. I welcome interdisciplinary collaborations that push the boundaries of interactive health technology and data science.
